item.title: Sending same message twice
item.dc:creator: @winK winK
item.description:
@winK wrote:

I don’t know why it’s calling this message twice when I kill a slayer monster.

if (player.getControlerManager().getControler() instanceof SlayerControler) { boolean hasSlayerRing = player.getEquipment().getRingId() == 13281; int currentPoints = player.getSlayerPoints(); player.setSlayerPoints(hasSlayerRing == true ? (currentPoints + (2*(npc.getCombatLevel()/4))) : (currentPoints + (npc.getCombatLevel()/4))); player.getSkills().addXp(Skills.SLAYER, npc.getCombatLevel()); player.sendMessage("You have been awarded "+(hasSlayerRing == true ? 2*(npc.getCombatLevel()/4) : npc.getCombatLevel()/4)+ " slayer points."+" You now have "+(currentPoints+(hasSlayerRing == true ? 2*(npc.getCombatLevel()/4) : npc.getCombatLevel()/4)+".")); }

Anyone have any idea why from that code? Or where else should I look? I assuming it’s being called twice somewhere. Once when the player does the killing hit and one when the monster despawns. I think.

Read full topic
